description: Beginning of first run of consecutive quadratic residues mod prime(n) of longest length.
example: The numbers 0, 1, 4, 5, 6, 9, 10, 11, 14, . . . are the squares mod 5, and 5 = prime(3), so a(3) = 4. - _Jonathan Sondow_, Jul 20 2014
author: _David W. Wilson_
extensions: Offset corrected to 1, definition clarified, _Jonathan Sondow_ Jul 20 2014
